sentence.Network_en: Meredith D'Ambrosio has thousands of songs in her repertoire.
sentence.Network_cn: 梅雷迪思·丹布罗西奥会唱几千首歌曲。

sentence.Network_en: His repertoire encompassed everything from Bach to Schoenberg.
sentence.Network_cn: 他能演奏从巴赫到勋伯格的所有作品。

sentence.Network_en: a pianist with a wide repertoire
sentence.Network_cn: 能演奏很多曲子的钢琴师

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French répertoire, from late Latin repertorium (see repertory)

entry.tran: （一个演员所能表演的）全部节目，曲目
entry.def: A per-former's repertoire is all the plays or pieces of music that he or she has learned and can perform.

example.ex: Meredith D'Ambrosio has thousands of songs in her repertoire.
example.tran: 梅雷迪思·丹布罗西奥会唱几千首歌曲。

entry.def: The repertoire of a person or thing is all the things of a particular kind that the person or thing is capable of doing.

example.tran: 迈克会讲大量有趣故事的非凡才能

example.ex: This has been one of the most successful desserts in my repertoire.
example.tran: 这是我会做的甜点中做得最成功的一种。

entry.tran: （某个种类的）全部剧目(或曲目)
entry.def: You can refer to all the plays or music of a particular kind as, for example, the classical repertoire or the jazz repertoire .

example.ex: It is no coincidence that the works in the 'standard repertoire' tend to have names.
example.tran: 在“标准剧目”中的作品有各自的名字并非偶然。

means.word_mean: 1. the entire range of skills or aptitudes or devices used in a particular field or occupation;

sentences.sentence: "the repertory of the supposed feats of mesmerism"
"has a large repertory of dialects and characters"

means.word_mean: 2. a collection of works that an artist or company can perform

sentences.en: There is an extensive repertoire of music written for the flute.
sentences.cn: 有很多供长笛演奏的曲目。

sentences.en: The harp has a very large repertoire.
sentences.cn: 这竖琴有很广泛的演奏曲目

jushi.english: There is an extensive repertoire of music written for the flute.
jushi.chinese: 有很多供长笛演奏的曲目。

jushi.english: They might perhaps be more adventurous in their repertoire.
jushi.chinese: 他们在保留节目中，或许显示出更多的原创性。
